caption.center: GREGORY CAMPBELL, Petitioner, v. MICHAEL W. MOORE, Secretary, Florida

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, First District.

opinion.posture: Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus â€” Original Jurisdiction.
opinion.attorneys:
Gregory Campbell, pro se, petitioner.
Robert A. Butterworth, Attorney General, Bart Schneider, Assistant Attorney General, and Edward C. Hill, Jr., Assistant Attorney General, Tallahassee, for respondent.
opinion.opinion_text:
Pursuant to Florida Rule of Appellate Procedure 9.140(j), we grant the petition seeking belated appeal of the judgment and sentence entered on July 19, 1996, in Escambia County Circuit Court case number 90-2530. The trial court shall treat this court's mandate as the notice of appeal. Fla.R.App.P. 9.140(j)(5)(D). If petitioner qualifies for appointed counsel, the trial court shall appoint counsel to represent petitioner on appeal.
JOANOS, KAHN and PADOVANO, JJ., concur.
NOT FINAL UNTIL TIME EXPIRES TO FILE REHEARING MOTION AND DISPOSITION THEREOF IF FILED.
